# Include external images

You can call the function `knitr::include_graphics()` in a code chunk to embed external images. This function works for all types of **knitr** source documents, such as Rnw and Rmd. Below is a simple example:

```{r}
library(knitr)
include_graphics('figure/003-minimal-fancy-rgl-1.png', dpi = NA)
```

You can pass a character vector of mutiple image paths to `include_graphics()`

```{r}
include_graphics(
  c("figure/003-minimal-fancy-rgl-1.png", 
    "figure/001-minimal-unnamed-chunk-2-1.png"), 
  dpi = NA
)
```

and you can also use chunk options related to figures, such as `out.width` and `fig.cap`, etc.

```{r, out.width = "50%"}
include_graphics(
  c("figure/003-minimal-fancy-rgl-1.png", 
    "figure/001-minimal-unnamed-chunk-2-1.png"), 
  dpi = NA
)
```

```{r, out.width = "50%", fig.cap="This is a caption"}
include_graphics('figure/003-minimal-fancy-rgl-1.png', dpi = NA)
```

```{r, out.width = "50%", fig.show="hold", fig.cap="This is a caption"}
include_graphics(
  c("figure/003-minimal-fancy-rgl-1.png", 
    "figure/001-minimal-unnamed-chunk-2-1.png"), 
  dpi = NA
)
```
